history.content: Not sure about the other classes but I have a point to raise for MATH 104. Difficulty and content varies among different sections taught. For example, sections using Rudin (Textbook) may be more rigorous than the classes using Ross/Pugh (Textbook). It also depends on the policies of the instructor.

children.subject: I see. Yeah, I only considered that as an option because I have heard that the relevant content from 61C for 161 can easily be self-studied so it isn't really a hard prereq. As for 188, I am assuming that the bulk of the workload comes from studying for the exams right? I have heard that it is a relatively light course otherwise.

Yeah, it's not a hard pre-req but 61C and 189 are on the heavier side (61C VERY heavy imo) so that first part of the semester when your self-learning some of the concepts might be rough.

And yes, 188 homeworks were pretty light and the projects were 61A style (fill in these lines, do this method, etc.) so the weekly out-of-class time commitment was maybe 2-3 hours for me (varies depending on the project or if I was spending extra time on disc or reading notes). The only spike was the week before the singular MT when I crammed a ton of practice exams, but even that was about average for a tech (I like doing lots of practice exams) and it's only 1 week in the semester so not a big deal.

I took 61C/170/188 and a breadth (P/NP) and it was on the heavier side but manageable. 189 is almost certainly heavier than 170 though (haven't taken it yet), so I would be cautious about overcommitting on extracurriculars.

Unless you feel comfortable with execution diagrams, stack/heap, etc. I would advise against taking 161 and 61C concurrently (relevant topics for beginning of 161 are taught towards middle of 61C). 188 is on the lighter side even with the copious amounts of practice before the exams imo (only one MT as well iirc), so I would definitely recommend 188 over 161 assuming no prior background on program execution/assembly.

Don't know anything about 104.

history.content: Looking for a third tech alongside 61C and 189 for fall 2020 (taking/taken 61ab, 16ab, 70, 170, 126). Which one would be the most manageable?
history.subject: 161 vs 188 vs math 104
